document.docAuthor: Sánchez-Montes, Sokani, Colunga-Salas, Pablo, Álvarez-Castillo, Lucía, Guzmán-Cornejo, Carmen & Montiel-Parra, Griselda
document.docTitle: Geomydoecus (Geomydoecus) welleri subsp. welleri welleri Price & Hellenthal 1981
document.masterDocTitle: Chewing lice (Insecta: Phthiraptera) associated with vertebrates in Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Chewing lice (Insecta: Phthiraptera) associated with vertebrates in Mexico

taxonomicName.emphasis: Geomydoecus ( Geomydoecus ) welleri welleri Price & Hellenthal 1981

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Geomydoecus welleri welleri
Price & Hellenthal, 1981b: 44
, figs 9, 12, 16, 19.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Estado de
Mexico
:
Thomomys umbrinus
, 10 km S, 16 km W Toluca de Lerdo, no date; 18 km S, 12 km W Toluca de Lerdo, no date; 1.5 mi ( 2.4 km ) S Valle de Bravo, no date; 6 mi ( 9.7 km ) E Valle de Bravo, no date; 10 mi ( 16.1 km ) N Valle de Bravo, no date; N slope Nevado de Toluca, no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Hidalgo :
Thomomys umbrinus
, 5 mi (8.0 km) E Tulancingo , no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Michoacán :
Thomomys umbrinus pullus
, 6.5 km S and 3 mi ( 4.8 km ) S Pátzcuaro), no date; 4 mi ( 6.4 km ) S and 5 mi (8.0 km) S Pátzcuaro, no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).

Puebla :
Thomomys umbrinus umbrinus
, 3.5 km S, 3 km E Esperanza, no date; Boca del Monte, no date;
Thomomys umbrinus
, San Martín, no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).

Tlaxcala :
Thomomys umbrinus
, 8 km S, 7 km W Calpulalpan, no date; 9 km N, 7 km E Apizaco, no date; 9 km N, 8 km E Apizaco, no date; 10 km N, 9 km E Apizaco, no date; 19 km W Tlaxcala , no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Veracruz :
Thomomys umbrinus
, 10 mi ( 16.1 km ) W Zacualpán , no date ( Price & Hellenthal 1981b ).
Types
:
Holotype female deposited in UMSP .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: Some hosts were identified by Price & Hellenthal (1981b) as “
Thomomys umbrinus peregrinus
”, “
Thomomys umbrinus tolucae
”, “
Thomomys umbrinus albigularis
” and “
Thomomys umbrinus martinensis
”.
